snippet: The South Ferry subway station is dark, the tracks are 20 to 25 feet underwater and rubble and items swept in from outside litter passages.
abstract: South Ferry subway station in Lower Manhattan, one of the subway system's jewels, remains without power, its tracks 20 to 25 feet underwater and platforms covered with rubble and items swept in from outside during Hurricane Sandy; much of the damage to the city's subway system is concentrated in its under-river tunnels, with few passenger stations suffering such devastating damage.
lead_paragraph: The South Ferry subway station is dark, the tracks are 20 to 25 feet underwater and rubble and items swept in from outside litter passages.

headline.seo: New South Ferry Subway Station Still Deep Under Water
headline.main: Where Ferry Riders Met Subway, the Hudson and Debris Now Block the Way
headline.print_headline: Where Ferry Riders Met Subway, the Hudson and Debris Now Block the Way
